Introduction
About Inline_C
Inline_C was written to provide an easy way to optimize the performance of critical code sections by rewriting them in C. The idea was to allow this to all be done from within userland php code, allowing for transparent 'gluing' and compiling of extension code.
Installation
short installation not:
This class has only been tried with php 4.2.3 and php4.3.
run the mkbuildtree appropriate for your system. mkbuildtree.4.2.3 for php-4.2.3, and mkbuildtree.head for php-4.3 or HEAD. Run this command as
mkbuildtree /absolute/path/to/builddir
This command builds out the build tree that Inline_C uses to build modules on the fly. This command should be run by the webserver user, or the created directories and files should be chowned to the webserver user.
If the php.ini value extension_dir is something other that './', then a subdir anme inline_libs of the extension_dir will be created. This directory must be writeable by the webserver user.
